N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 2813.2 - Application submission requirements

State Regulations
(a) The applicant must complete such forms
and attachments as prescribed by the division. (b) Essential components of the application
include: (1)
documentation supporting the
eligibility of both the applicant and the region; (2)
general goals in effecting regional
preservation, stabilization or improvement; (3)
quantified, measurable objectives to be
accomplished by the completion of the activities proposed in the work
plan; (4)
financial plan, including
budget specifying the use of funds requested from the division, other financial
resources, including the one-third match requirement and staffing
pattern; (5)
a plan for securing
funds from other sources, for administrative and planning costs; (6)
documentation of community
support; (7)
documentation that any
fees received or proposed to be received by the company in connection with its
activities are fair and reasonable; (8)
evidence that the company will, to the
extent possible, give preference in hiring to residents of the region who are
unemployed or underemployed; (9)
evidence that the company will, to the maximum extent feasible, dispose of
residential buildings owned or to be acquired by it to the occupants thereof or
to cooperative groups whose members shall be occupants thereof; and
(10)
evidence that due consideration will be
given to the interests of occupants of properties owned or to be acquired by
the company. Notes
